summary: This document is a response to subpoenas served on various entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein, detailing the lack of documents responsive to certain requests and providing some IRS forms and corporate information. It highlights the dissolution of one entity and outlines the ongoing efforts to ascertain the existence of other requested documents. This document contains subpoenas issued to various entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein, commanding them to testify before a Grand Jury and produce specific documents related to Epstein's activities and financial transactions. It outlines the requirements for compliance and details the types of records requested, including communications and financial documents. This document consists of correspondence from A. Marie Villafana, Assistant U.S. Attorney, to Gerald Lefcourt regarding subpoenas issued to various Epstein-related corporations. It includes certifications regarding the domestic records of these entities in response to grand jury subpoenas, indicating the status of document searches and compliance. This document includes a subpoena issued to Financial Trust Company, Inc. to testify before a Grand Jury regarding various records related to Jeffrey Epstein and others. It outlines the specific documents and information required for compliance, including communications and financial records. This document contains various financial records, including wage and tax statements for individuals associated with the Financial Trust Company in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands. It includes details about income, tax withholdings, and other financial transactions related to named individuals.

keyFacts: Gerald B. Lefcourt is the attorney responding to subpoenas on behalf of entities associated with J. Epstein.
The subpoenas were issued on May 31, 2007, and are related to various financial documents.
J. Epstein & Co., Inc. was dissolved in December 2000, which affects the availability of documents.
The response indicates that no documents are available for several of the requests made in the subpoenas.
The document includes references to various IRS forms related to the entities mentioned.
Subpoenas were issued to J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc., J. Epstein & Company, Inc., and Epstein Interests.
The subpoenas require the production of various documents including communications and financial records.
The subpoenas are part of an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities and financial dealings.
A. Marie Villafana is communicating with Gerald Lefcourt regarding subpoenas related to Epstein's corporations.
Subpoenas were issued to J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc., J. Epstein & Co., Inc., Epstein Interests, and Financial Trust Company, Inc.
The document includes certifications regarding the domestic records of these corporations in response to grand jury subpoenas.
There are indications that some corporations have no documents responsive to certain requests in the subpoenas.
The correspondence is dated June 19, 2007.
The subpoena was issued to Financial Trust Company, Inc. to testify before the Grand Jury.
Jeffrey Epstein, Lesley Groff, and Ghislaine Maxwell are mentioned as key figures in the subpoena.
The subpoena requests various records including communications and financial transactions from January 1, 2003, to the present.
Nesbitt Kuyrkendall is the FBI Special Agent coordinating the compliance with the subpoena.
Several individuals associated with Epstein are mentioned in relation to financial transactions and corporate governance.
The document contains multiple wage and tax statements for various employees of the Financial Trust Company.
Jeffrey E Epstein is mentioned multiple times in relation to financial transactions.
The records include details about income and tax withholdings for the year 2005 and earlier.
